options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. There are 3 unlabeled plot points on the grid. The first point is 1 unit to the right and 3 units up from the origin. The second point is 2 units to the right and 6 units up from the origin. The third point is 3 units to the right and 9 units up from the origin. A red arrow moves right on the x-axis from the origin to the 1. A purple arrow moves up 3 units from the 1 on the x-axis to align with the 3 on the y-axis, ending at the first point, labeled (1,3).

hints.content:
###$(\redE2, \square )$



[[☃ image 1]]

So when the value of $\redE{x}=\redE{2}$, then $\purpleD{y}=\purpleD{6}$.

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. There are 3 unlabeled plot points on the grid. The first point is 1 unit to the right and 3 units up from the origin. The second point is 2 units to the right and 6 units up from the origin. The third point is 3 units to the right and 9 units up from the origin. A red arrow moves right on the x-axis from the origin to the 2. A purple arrow moves up 6 units from the 2 on the x-axis to align with the 6 on the y-axis, ending at the second point, labeled (2,6).

hints.content:
###$(\redE3, \square)$



[[☃ image 1]]

When the value of $\redE{x}=\redE{3}$, then $\purpleD{y}=\purpleD{9}$.

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. There are 3 unlabeled plot points on the grid. The first point is 1 unit to the right and 3 units up from the origin. The second point is 2 units to the right and 6 units up from the origin. The third point is 3 units to the right and 9 units up from the origin. A red arrow moves right on the x-axis from the origin to the 3. A purple arrow moves up 9 units from the 3 on the x-axis to align with the 9 on the y-axis, ending at the third point, labeled (3,9).

question.content:
The points on the following graph shows the relationship between $x$ and $y$.


[[☃ image 1]]

**First, complete the table of $x$- and $y$-coordinates.**


$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$1$ | [[☃ numeric-input 4]]
$2$ | [[☃ numeric-input 5]]
$3$ | [[☃ numeric-input 6]]


**Next, which rule describes the relationship between $x$ and $y$ in the graph?**

[[☃ radio 2]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. There are 3 unlabeled plot points on the grid. The first point is 1 unit to the right and 3 units up from the origin. The second point is 2 units to the right and 6 units up from the origin. The third point is 3 units to the right and 9 units up from the origin.
